content: chore: adaptations for nightly-2025-03-28 #23400 Please review this PR. At the end of the month this diff will land in 'master'.
There's quite a bit to review here, as we had a couple of days without a successful nightly-testing.

Most of the diff is adaptation to #7672, where I reviewed the implicitness of arguments in List/Array/Vector lemmas. This results in many fewer _s in places, but also some places where we now need to use a named argument. In some, but not all, cases, I reverted such arguments back to explicit. Generally, if it appeared that the usage was rewriting from right to left in an "unexpected" way, I decided that having to use a named argument was okay, and the argument could stay implicit.

However I'm very happy to make further changes, and if anyone wants to mention or list lemmas here that they'd like to have restored to their original explicitness, I'm happy to review and make that happen.
Particularly @Yaël Dillies might be interested here. :-)
I'm imagining that we will merge this PR in any case soon, as release day is approaching, but I can make further changes in the next nightly.
I can't comment on the changes to files in the Cache directory but other than that this looks fine to me.

Kim Morrison said:

Most of the diff is adaptation to #7672

I think this is adaptation to lean4#7672

@Yaël Dillies, I'm going to wait on making changes based on your "rewriting rule" rule, until you have a chance to write that up, and we can adopt it (or not) as an official suggestion. (I am somewhat skeptical of it at present.)

We can go back to this diff to identify prospective changes that would then need to be made.

I propose we merge this as is (I've made all the suggested changes besides the rewriting rule changes, and in any case those could only be made on a future nightly), as we have another adaptation PR waiting to be made, and hopefully releasing a new release candidate tomorrow.
